title: ReproRes 2024
text:
Make sure you can access Moodle
Bookmark the Teams channel for PSYCH5077 and Introduce yourself
Read the overview and Chapter 1 of the textbook
Install R and RStudio on your computer

post on Teams if you run into problems
if you don’t have a personal computer, you can use university computers; log on and familiarise yourself with R and RStudio
If you have a chromebook or tablet, you can’t install R, but can use the RStudio server (log in with your GUID)

Download and render the test file{download} to check that your setup is accurate
Add these assessment dates to your diary

2024-10-09 (10%) A project with a qmd file showing basic reproducible report skills (chapters 1-2)
2024-10-23 (20%) A project demonstrating data visualisation and summary skills (chapters 3-4)
2024-11-13 (30%) A project demonstrating data wrangling skills (chapters 5-7)
2024-12-11 (40%) A project showing power simulation (chapters 8-10)

Fill out the pre-class poll





Poll 1
Open the class book
Open RStudio
Start at 13:05
Why Code? presentation
Discuss the class syllabus
Break
Chapter 1 live code





log into desktops with campus\12345678X and GUID password





Read Chapter 2: Reports
Complete the exercises for chapter 2
Look at assessment 1

title: ReproRes 2024
text:
Make sure you can access Moodle
Bookmark the Teams channel for PSYCH5077 and Introduce yourself
Read the overview and Chapter 1 of the textbook
Install R and RStudio on your computer

post on Teams if you run into problems
if you don’t have a personal computer, you can use university computers; log on and familiarise yourself with R and RStudio
If you have a chromebook or tablet, you can’t install R, but can use the RStudio server (log in with your GUID)

Download and render the test file{download} to check that your setup is accurate
Add these assessment dates to your diary

2024-10-09 (10%) A project with a qmd file showing basic reproducible report skills (chapters 1-2)
2024-10-23 (20%) A project demonstrating data visualisation and summary skills (chapters 3-4)
2024-11-13 (30%) A project demonstrating data wrangling skills (chapters 5-7)
2024-12-11 (40%) A project showing power simulation (chapters 8-10)

1. importing data and organising/sorting it. 2. Starting scripts and Rmarkdown files 3. knowing what all the different symbols mean and how to use them. 4. The value of producing reproducible reports. 5. How to properly name files so they are well organised and useable. 6. Setting and working from directories. 7. How to produce a bibliography from a reference manager. 8. creating headings and subheadings. 9. creating bold and/or italic text 10. creating code chunks using backticks 11. how to make a code chunk be visible in the Rmarkdown file but not in the knitted output 12. how to create a basic table 14. how to include an image from a html link 15. how to create clickable hyperlinks in the knitted file
